page.title: 03Local History(2)
page.content: There are also other interesting historical remains in the area. Eccleswall Court,now a farm,stands on the site of Eccleswall Castle.This site has not been excavated but there is a tower which might have been part of the castle.Relics supporting this theory have been found but not recently.On the same site at Eccleswall there are the remains of a chapel which is at least 500 years old.Still in existence is the pond which the monks built so they could keep a supply of trout,their Friday dinner. Not far away Bury Hill Chapel is steeped in history.During the Roman occupation the busy smelting station of Ariconium occupied the area of the chapel and here long before Ross began to take shape the arts of civilisation were practised.
